title: Questions over Labour's green energy plans
text:
Labour unveiled its ambitious renewable energy strategy on Thursday, aiming to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to net zero 20 years earlier than the Government’s target.

If it wins the next general election, the party has said it will develop 22,000 football pitches of new solar panels and upgrade insulation for every home.

Labour has also pledged to build an additional 9,000 wind turbines in an effort to generate 90pc of the country’s electricity from renewable sources by 2030.

The investment from such measures would lead to a net benefit of £800bn for the economy and create 850,000 new skilled jobs in green industry.

In an attempt to reduce reliance on gas heating, Labour’s strategy also calls...
description: Labour unveiled its ambitious renewable energy strategy on Thursday, aiming to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to net zero 20 years earlier than the Government’s target.
